title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: Dalkeith!" she snorted, eeing me with some contempt, doubtless taking me for a greater gawky than I was. " Dalkeith ! this is no Dalkeith, but Little France as I tell'd you. Dalkeith's a gude three mile further alang the road."

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " There's nane that I wot o' : it's Little France ye're in," said she. " Maybe ye've heard tell o't ? "

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " Little France," said I. " Nay, I never heard the name before." But yet, as I answered her, the thing had a familiar ring about it that puzzled me.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " Little France ! " I exclaimed, for I could not call to mind that I had ever heard the name, whilk was not to be marvelled at, seeing I had never been that gate before, nor, indeed, a bowshot, as it were, from the Capital.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: Some-deal disturbed, as much by his manner as by his speech, I held my peace until he had tended his beast, and we were gotten out into the garden ; but once there, and safe from eavesdroppers, Gregory and I unloosed our tongues, and were soon possessed of one anothers' doings since our last being thegether. Gregory, I learned it was and no other that I had seen that night I lodged in the house at Little France. By gude hap, it seems, he had been discovered by John Ballon, an auld companion in arms, and a retainer of Morton's, by whose aid he had been transported to the biggin.
